A few factions have involved themselves in the process. foremost being the Colonial Union and the Wolden-Dorf Corporation. It’s strange seeing such different people work together to make one planetary settlement come to fruition. I hope these types of projects will improve relations between the faction leaders in the future.
Translated Text: Preparing this planet for colonization has been a tremendous ordeal. A few factions have involved themselves in the process. foremost being the Colonial Union and the Wolden-Dorf Corporation. It’s strange seeing such different people work together to make one planetary settlement come to fruition. I hope these types of projects will improve relations between the faction leaders in the future.

Original Text: Orsine is the overseer of this project. If you have any concerns. head down this hatch and speak with her. She always knows what to do.
Translated Text: Orsine is the overseer of this project. If you have any concerns. head down this hatch and speak with her. She always knows what to do.

Original Text: Even with all our preparations. conditions are still harsh. Life will be tough here. But it won’t be impossible. Underground facilities may end up comprising most of the colony. but the colonists will manage. They’ll learn how to bring the best out of this place. I may end up applying for colonization status here one day. myself.
Translated Text: Even with all our preparations. conditions are still harsh. Life will be tough here. But it won’t be impossible. Underground facilities may end up comprising most of the colony. but the colonists will manage. They’ll learn how to bring the best out of this place. I may end up applying for colonization status here one day. myself.

Original Text: The Command Center is very choosy about which volunteers are to be the colonists of a new planet. They need to consider a lot of factors that involve balancing skill sets. predicting genetic variation. analyzing both physical and psychological fortitude of each individual. It isn’t an easy task to colonize a new world. The people who are selected for the task must be quite remarkable.
Translated Text: The Command Center is very choosy about which volunteers are to be the colonists of a new planet. They need to consider a lot of factors that involve balancing skill sets. predicting genetic variation. analyzing both physical and psychological fortitude of each individual. It isn’t an easy task to colonize a new world. The people who are selected for the task must be quite remarkable.

Original Text: The W.D. Corporation is lending the new colony technology to accurately calculate the extreme and unpredictable weather conditions on this planet. It’s still experimental. but I think it’ll help the colonists quite a bit.
Translated Text: The W.D. Corporation is lending the new colony technology to accurately calculate the extreme and unpredictable weather conditions on this planet. It’s still experimental. but I think it’ll help the colonists quite a bit.

Original Text: Excuse me. I’m a little busy dealing with an ExoSuit malfunction here. Could you give me some privacy?
Translated Text: Excuse me. I’m a little busy dealing with an ExoSuit malfunction here. Could you give me some privacy?

Original Text: This blasted planet is so cold. I’m freezing. even in my ExoSuit. I don’t know how the other workers can stand it.
Translated Text: This blasted planet is so cold. I’m freezing. even in my ExoSuit. I don’t know how the other workers can stand it.

Original Text: I happen to be one of the colonists who was selected to live here. Due to my experience constructing bases on foreign planets. the Command Center requested my assistance with initial preparations for the colony. I’m impressed by the determination these workers have shown in establishing a secure hub for the settlement. May the future be bright for this place.
Translated Text: I happen to be one of the colonists who was selected to live here. Due to my experience constructing bases on foreign planets. the Command Center requested my assistance with initial preparations for the colony. I’m impressed by the determination these workers have shown in establishing a secure hub for the settlement. May the future be bright for this place.

Original Text: You climbed all the way up here to speak with XR-93118? Is there something you need? If you are looking for business. XR-93118 would be willing to conduct a small trade. XR-93118 has little to sell. but can purchase any extraneous supplies you might be carrying. The new colony will need all the supplies it can get.
Translated Text: You climbed all the way up here to speak with XR-93118? Is there something you need? If you are looking for business. XR-93118 would be willing to conduct a small trade. XR-93118 has little to sell. but can purchase any extraneous supplies you might be carrying. The new colony will need all the supplies it can get.

Original Text: Greetings. my friend. What can I do for you?
Translated Text: Greetings. my friend. What can I do for you?

Original Text: Thank you. May the stars favor your voyages forever more.
Translated Text: Thank you. May the stars favor your voyages forever more.

Original Text: That is…truly unfortunate. Have you come to trade then?
Translated Text: That is…truly unfortunate. Have you come to trade then?

Original Text: I sense you have the artifact I have been seeking for so long. Would you allow me the honor of purchasing it from you? I’ll pay 15.000 credits. Far more than any other trader in this galaxy will offer.
Translated Text: I sense you have the artifact I have been seeking for so long. Would you allow me the honor of purchasing it from you? I’ll pay 15.000 credits. Far more than any other trader in this galaxy will offer.

Original Text: Ah. so you’ve taken a notice to my collection. It isn’t very impressive. I’ll admit so myself. These sculptures were created by a civilization that died off several thousand years ago. Unfortunately. I have never come across one that isn’t irreparably damaged. If you find a whole sculpture on your travels. I would be willing to purchase it from you for a sizeable price.
Translated Text: Ah. so you’ve taken a notice to my collection. It isn’t very impressive. I’ll admit so myself. These sculptures were created by a civilization that died off several thousand years ago. Unfortunately. I have never come across one that isn’t irreparably damaged. If you find a whole sculpture on your travels. I would be willing to purchase it from you for a sizeable price.

Original Text: It seems another customer has wandered into my shop. What can I do for you?
Translated Text: It seems another customer has wandered into my shop. What can I do for you?

Original Text: Why. hello. Enjoying the weather out here? I always find it a little chilly for my tastes.
Translated Text: Why. hello. Enjoying the weather out here? I always find it a little chilly for my tastes.

Original Text: Good to see you again. We have met before. correct? I’m sure we have.
Translated Text: Good to see you again. We have met before. correct? I’m sure we have.

Original Text: Yes. this is the U.S.S. Galicus. We requested assistance. If you are the crew that was sent by the Command Center. help subdue this threat.
Translated Text: Yes. this is the U.S.S. Galicus. We requested assistance. If you are the crew that was sent by the Command Center. help subdue this threat.

Original Text: Thank you for warping out here to assist us. The Rustbucket caught us off-guard. we’ll admit. It can be difficult to distinguish an innocent ship from a compromised one these days. We appreciate your help. and we’ll be sure to put in a good word with the Command Center.
Translated Text: Thank you for warping out here to assist us. The Rustbucket caught us off-guard. we’ll admit. It can be difficult to distinguish an innocent ship from a compromised one these days. We appreciate your help. and we’ll be sure to put in a good word with the Command Center.

Original Text: Captain of the U.S.S. Gallantry speaking. We appreciate you coming out to this sector. but there is work to be done. Let us refrain from pleasantries until these fiends are dealt with.
Translated Text: Captain of the U.S.S. Gallantry speaking. We appreciate you coming out to this sector. but there is work to be done. Let us refrain from pleasantries until these fiends are dealt with.

Original Text: You have our thanks. [PLAYERSHIP_NAME]. The galaxy is growing more dangerous with the rise of Alliance activity. Be on your guard. We. too. will do our best to be more vigilant in the future.
Translated Text: You have our thanks. [PLAYERSHIP_NAME]. The galaxy is growing more dangerous with the rise of Alliance activity. Be on your guard. We. too. will do our best to be more vigilant in the future.

Original Text: You weren’t the best fighters I’ve seen. but your help was appreciated. I’ve transferred your share to you.
Translated Text: You weren’t the best fighters I’ve seen. but your help was appreciated. I’ve transferred your share to you.

Original Text: Stop hailing us! Fire your weapons!
Translated Text: Stop hailing us! Fire your weapons!

Original Text: We finished the job. That’s all there is to it. We don’t intend to linger around here longer than we have to.
Translated Text: We finished the job. That’s all there is to it. We don’t intend to linger around here longer than we have to.

Original Text: Thank you. truly. We will inform the Colonial Union Command Center of how you aided us. Please. take these credits for your troubles.
Translated Text: Thank you. truly. We will inform the Colonial Union Command Center of how you aided us. Please. take these credits for your troubles.

Original Text: It is unfortunate that you must resort to such measures. We’ll see you in battle.
Translated Text: It is unfortunate that you must resort to such measures. We’ll see you in battle.

Original Text: W.D. vessel. we suspect that Corporation Headquarters sent you to dispatch us. Please. do not charge your weapons. We intend to leave the W.D. zone immediately. If you let us pass. Wolden-Dorf Headquarters may not be pleased. but the Colonial Union will be grateful to you.
Translated Text: W.D. vessel. we suspect that Corporation Headquarters sent you to dispatch us. Please. do not charge your weapons. We intend to leave the W.D. zone immediately. If you let us pass. Wolden-Dorf Headquarters may not be pleased. but the Colonial Union will be grateful to you.

Original Text: Good. Just don’t wander out too far. or you’ll end up like my last lab partner. He was swallowed while trying to collect a sample of sandshark epidermis. Luckily we had a functional atrium back then. He quit after that.
Translated Text: Good. Just don’t wander out too far. or you’ll end up like my last lab partner. He was swallowed while trying to collect a sample of sandshark epidermis. Luckily we had a functional atrium back then. He quit after that.

Original Text: If you haven’t noticed. this facility is dedicated wholly to the study of a creature called the ‘sandshark’. It has a unique physiology that intrigued scientists for decades. Even though interest in sandshark study has plummeted. I’ve dedicated my life’s work to these creatures. In fact. I’m currently on the verge of a great discovery in sandshark mating habits. A little ways from my lab. there’s a rocky nest right on the edge of sandshark territory. I believe an egg was laid there just a few days ago. and I need it for my research. Get it for me. and I’ll pay you a few credits.
Translated Text: If you haven’t noticed. this facility is dedicated wholly to the study of a creature called the ‘sandshark’. It has a unique physiology that intrigued scientists for decades. Even though interest in sandshark study has plummeted. I’ve dedicated my life’s work to these creatures. In fact. I’m currently on the verge of a great discovery in sandshark mating habits. A little ways from my lab. there’s a rocky nest right on the edge of sandshark territory. I believe an egg was laid there just a few days ago. and I need it for my research. Get it for me. and I’ll pay you a few credits.

Original Text: Are you with the Association of Ethical Research? If so. I assure you—my work follows strict ethical protocols. all up to standards. Oh…you aren’t here to inspect my lab? Well. that’s a relief. I might even use your help.
Translated Text: Are you with the Association of Ethical Research? If so. I assure you—my work follows strict ethical protocols. all up to standards. Oh…you aren’t here to inspect my lab? Well. that’s a relief. I might even use your help.

Original Text: Thank you for bringing the egg to me. It’s a perfect specimen. Now. take your payment and go. I have a lot of work to do.
Translated Text: Thank you for bringing the egg to me. It’s a perfect specimen. Now. take your payment and go. I have a lot of work to do.

Original Text: Where’s my sandshark egg? Do you have it?
Translated Text: Where’s my sandshark egg? Do you have it?

Original Text: If you’re this interested in sandshark research. I still have an open position for a lab assistant.
Translated Text: If you’re this interested in sandshark research. I still have an open position for a lab assistant.

Original Text: If you're not going to help with my research. get out of here. I have a lot of work to do.
Translated Text: If you're not going to help with my research. get out of here. I have a lot of work to do.

Original Text: Find and retrieve research logs from a vacated CU waystation.
Translated Text: Find and retrieve research logs from a vacated CU waystation.

Original Text: Thank you. There’s a lift outside that can take you up to the mines. Please. be careful.
Translated Text: Thank you. There’s a lift outside that can take you up to the mines. Please. be careful.

Original Text: Oh. you aren't here to help? My mistake. Please take care.
Translated Text: Oh. you aren't here to help? My mistake. Please take care.

Original Text: Are you here to help? We are in great need of assistance right now. Not long ago. our miners discovered a large deposit of an alien ore in the caves. The ore emitted a strange noise when they first unearthed it. and none of our equipment was able to remove little more than stray fragments from the central vein. Earlier today. insect-like creatures burrowed their way through the mines and have now taken it over. They seem drawn to that strange ore. I don’t know what to do about the ore. but if nothing is done to rid of those creatures. I fear we could lose the mines entirely.
Translated Text: Are you here to help? We are in great need of assistance right now. Not long ago. our miners discovered a large deposit of an alien ore in the caves. The ore emitted a strange noise when they first unearthed it. and none of our equipment was able to remove little more than stray fragments from the central vein. Earlier today. insect-like creatures burrowed their way through the mines and have now taken it over. They seem drawn to that strange ore. I don’t know what to do about the ore. but if nothing is done to rid of those creatures. I fear we could lose the mines entirely.

Original Text: That’s a great relief. We are incredibly appreciative to you for help. Please. take these credits. Thanks to you. we may have another chance to continue our work here.
Translated Text: That’s a great relief. We are incredibly appreciative to you for help. Please. take these credits. Thanks to you. we may have another chance to continue our work here.

Original Text: Have you been to the mines yet? Are the creatures gone?
Translated Text: Have you been to the mines yet? Are the creatures gone?

Original Text: We thank you for everything you’ve done. May your journeys be safe and bring you success. Together. we survive.
Translated Text: We thank you for everything you’ve done. May your journeys be safe and bring you success. Together. we survive.

Original Text: We thank you for everything you’ve done. May your journeys be safe and bring you success.
Translated Text: We thank you for everything you’ve done. May your journeys be safe and bring you success.

Original Text: You don't need to worry about us. We'll find someone who is willing to help. Thank you for trying.
Translated Text: You don't need to worry about us. We'll find someone who is willing to help. Thank you for trying.

Original Text: Aben and Gosia are doing their best. They started this mining base nine Union-standard years ago. and they’ve treated us kindly every day since. Aben is struggling over the deaths of the other workers. but he couldn’t have known those things would burrow into our tunnels.
Translated Text: Aben and Gosia are doing their best. They started this mining base nine Union-standard years ago. and they’ve treated us kindly every day since. Aben is struggling over the deaths of the other workers. but he couldn’t have known those things would burrow into our tunnels.

Original Text: Mining operations have ground to a halt. Hostile creatures flooded into our tunnels. and three of our miners were killed in the attack. If you think you can help. please speak with Gosia inside. She’ll tell you what needs to be done and will compensate you as best she can.
Translated Text: Mining operations have ground to a halt. Hostile creatures flooded into our tunnels. and three of our miners were killed in the attack. If you think you can help. please speak with Gosia inside. She’ll tell you what needs to be done and will compensate you as best she can.

Original Text: I saw you go into the mines. Did you really get rid of those creatures? All of them? Thank you for helping us. We would’ve had to abandon our work otherwise. Now we’ll have to figure out what to do with that weird pillar of ore.
Translated Text: I saw you go into the mines. Did you really get rid of those creatures? All of them? Thank you for helping us. We would’ve had to abandon our work otherwise. Now we’ll have to figure out what to do with that weird pillar of ore.

Original Text: When those creatures broke through the tunnels. one of our fellow workers was severely injured and three others were killed. All of us who survived were cleared out for now. but those things are still inside. There’s too many for us to handle.
Translated Text: When those creatures broke through the tunnels. one of our fellow workers was severely injured and three others were killed. All of us who survived were cleared out for now. but those things are still inside. There’s too many for us to handle.

Original Text: I am no longer sensing alien lifesigns from the mines. You removed the creatures. I assume? Gosia and Aben will be grateful.
Translated Text: I am no longer sensing alien lifesigns from the mines. You removed the creatures. I assume? Gosia and Aben will be grateful.

Original Text: My sensors indicated six hostile lifeforms last I was in the mines. More creatures may have arrived since then. If you intend to enter the mines. exercise caution.
Translated Text: My sensors indicated six hostile lifeforms last I was in the mines. More creatures may have arrived since then. If you intend to enter the mines. exercise caution.

Original Text: I heard you removed the creatures from our mines. You have my thanks…
Translated Text: I heard you removed the creatures from our mines. You have my thanks…

Original Text: …When we first built this place. we couldn’t afford an Atrium. I knew mining on this planet was a dangerous line of work. but I thought our workers would be fine with a few guidelines and safety precautions. Now. we’ve lost so many good men and women. Maybe if we had cut our expenses and used older equipment. we could’ve bought an Atrium. Then those workers might be still be alive…
Translated Text: …When we first built this place. we couldn’t afford an Atrium. I knew mining on this planet was a dangerous line of work. but I thought our workers would be fine with a few guidelines and safety precautions. Now. we’ve lost so many good men and women. Maybe if we had cut our expenses and used older equipment. we could’ve bought an Atrium. Then those workers might be still be alive…

Original Text: All this dust is clouding up my helmet. How can you breathe without a respirator? If I were you. I’d be suffering from severe allergies right about now.
Translated Text: All this dust is clouding up my helmet. How can you breathe without a respirator? If I were you. I’d be suffering from severe allergies right about now.

Original Text: This is a nice view. If I wasn’t in so many places at once. I’d think about settling down here. Just don’t look too close at the edges of this rock. We aren’t supposed to be up this way. so the textures get a little strange.
Translated Text: This is a nice view. If I wasn’t in so many places at once. I’d think about settling down here. Just don’t look too close at the edges of this rock. We aren’t supposed to be up this way. so the textures get a little strange.

Original Text: Yes? What do you want to drink?
Translated Text: Yes? What do you want to drink?

Original Text: Once. I was caught in the middle of a fight between a Colonial Union extermination ship and an Infected creature. It was unlike anything you've ever seen. Pods and lasers were flying constantly between the two. I was barely able to warp out of there in one piece.
Translated Text: Once. I was caught in the middle of a fight between a Colonial Union extermination ship and an Infected creature. It was unlike anything you've ever seen. Pods and lasers were flying constantly between the two. I was barely able to warp out of there in one piece.

Original Text: If you ever hear Brenus going on about some big accomplishment of his. tune him out. None of it is real. just stories he made up while blathering over his sixth cup of Sylvassi ale.
Translated Text: If you ever hear Brenus going on about some big accomplishment of his. tune him out. None of it is real. just stories he made up while blathering over his sixth cup of Sylvassi ale.

Original Text: I heard that the W.D. flagship recently warped to this galaxy. Must have something to do with that W.D. boss Sullivan Vorcolp. Hard to believe the Corporation would lend out the flagship at one man’s behest. but it seems they agreed. Strange. isn’t it? The Estate and the W.D. flagship in the same galaxy for the first time in history. What are the chances?
Translated Text: I heard that the W.D. flagship recently warped to this galaxy. Must have something to do with that W.D. boss Sullivan Vorcolp. Hard to believe the Corporation would lend out the flagship at one man’s behest. but it seems they agreed. Strange. isn’t it? The Estate and the W.D. flagship in the same galaxy for the first time in history. What are the chances?

Original Text: Are you participating in the engine sludge competition? I’d certainly hope not. That’s a surefire way to turn your stomach contents into tar. If you know what’s best for you. you’ll steer clear of these shenanigans.
Translated Text: Are you participating in the engine sludge competition? I’d certainly hope not. That’s a surefire way to turn your stomach contents into tar. If you know what’s best for you. you’ll steer clear of these shenanigans.

Original Text: I used to be unbeaten in engine sludge contests. but it seems my health got the better of me last year. Still. no one can stomach sludge like I can.
Translated Text: I used to be unbeaten in engine sludge contests. but it seems my health got the better of me last year. Still. no one can stomach sludge like I can.

Original Text: Urk...I don't think...I can drink much more...
Translated Text: Urk...I don't think...I can drink much more...

Original Text: Don't want to be bothered. Thanks.
Translated Text: Don't want to be bothered. Thanks.

Original Text: I used to work for the Colonial Union. I was loyal. Idealistic. But circumstances change.
Translated Text: I used to work for the Colonial Union. I was loyal. Idealistic. But circumstances change.

Original Text: Our crew makes a living off planet reaping. It’s usually a lucrative business. Not many people dare to carve deep into planets to lift out the more valuable materials. The way I see it. if a sentient race hasn’t yet claimed a planet. it belongs to anyone who chooses to stake their claim. To hell with Colonial Union regulations. The universe is open for the taking.
Translated Text: Our crew makes a living off planet reaping. It’s usually a lucrative business. Not many people dare to carve deep into planets to lift out the more valuable materials. The way I see it. if a sentient race hasn’t yet claimed a planet. it belongs to anyone who chooses to stake their claim. To hell with Colonial Union regulations. The universe is open for the taking.

Original Text: Don’t have much to say to you. You’d best move on.
Translated Text: Don’t have much to say to you. You’d best move on.

Original Text: I discovered this peculiar ore the last time we were planetside. When I first unearthed it. I noticed a spike in my sensor readings. It was emitting a strange wavelength. and it seemed to draw creatures out of the caverns. Since then. I haven’t gotten any strange sensor readings from this sample. but I intend to perform another series of tests to see if it could be a material with a more profitable application.
Translated Text: I discovered this peculiar ore the last time we were planetside. When I first unearthed it. I noticed a spike in my sensor readings. It was emitting a strange wavelength. and it seemed to draw creatures out of the caverns. Since then. I haven’t gotten any strange sensor readings from this sample. but I intend to perform another series of tests to see if it could be a material with a more profitable application.

Original Text: Planet reapers make hefty profits on the raw materials they harvest from planets. It's a lucrative line of work...so long as you don't get caught by the Union. Punishments for planet reaping are about as bad as unsanctioned terraforming. It takes years to reap a planet. too. That's why you find most planet reapers out in the fringe galaxies like this. It's more likely they won't get caught.
Translated Text: Planet reapers make hefty profits on the raw materials they harvest from planets. It's a lucrative line of work...so long as you don't get caught by the Union. Punishments for planet reaping are about as bad as unsanctioned terraforming. It takes years to reap a planet. too. That's why you find most planet reapers out in the fringe galaxies like this. It's more likely they won't get caught.

Original Text: I've got some rare items in stock. Guaranteed. you've never seen anything like them before. Care to take a look?
Translated Text: I've got some rare items in stock. Guaranteed. you've never seen anything like them before. Care to take a look?

Original Text: Can I interest you in some drone meat? Drone meat. my friend. It is most nutritious. Please. buy some.
Translated Text: Can I interest you in some drone meat? Drone meat. my friend. It is most nutritious. Please. buy some.

Original Text: Finest weapons this galaxy has to offer. Need a piece for a job? We'll have whatever you're looking for.
Translated Text: Finest weapons this galaxy has to offer. Need a piece for a job? We'll have whatever you're looking for.

Original Text: Scanners. repair tools. extinguishers. I have them all. good quality too. If you choose to browse my stock. please take your time.
Translated Text: Scanners. repair tools. extinguishers. I have them all. good quality too. If you choose to browse my stock. please take your time.

Original Text: Need to stock up on rations?
Translated Text: Need to stock up on rations?

Original Text: Get out of here. I want no further business with you.
Translated Text: Get out of here. I want no further business with you.

Original Text: You dealt with that fool and conned him out of some credits? HA! I quite like you. Technically. the credits weren't his to give. but I'll let you keep them. You've earned them anyway. Here is your original payment. as promised. And good luck with your endeavors.
Translated Text: You dealt with that fool and conned him out of some credits? HA! I quite like you. Technically. the credits weren't his to give. but I'll let you keep them. You've earned them anyway. Here is your original payment. as promised. And good luck with your endeavors.

Original Text: ...Is that so? Because one of my active tracking vessels just reported spotting The Wonderment no more than ten minutes ago. Curious. Either my state-of-the-art tracking vessels are suddenly having sensor issues. or you are lying to me. Which could it be? Be careful. now. You may have just insulted the intelligence of the wrong person. Get out of here. I won't be hiring you again.
Translated Text: ...Is that so? Because one of my active tracking vessels just reported spotting The Wonderment no more than ten minutes ago. Curious. Either my state-of-the-art tracking vessels are suddenly having sensor issues. or you are lying to me. Which could it be? Be careful. now. You may have just insulted the intelligence of the wrong person. Get out of here. I won't be hiring you again.

Original Text: Well. that's a relief. I trust it wasn't too difficult to rid of that slimy thief. Here is the payment. as promised. Plus a little extra. for your trustworthiness. You are indeed a reliable crew. I appreciate reliability. Good luck with your future jobs.
Translated Text: Well. that's a relief. I trust it wasn't too difficult to rid of that slimy thief. Here is the payment. as promised. Plus a little extra. for your trustworthiness. You are indeed a reliable crew. I appreciate reliability. Good luck with your future jobs.

Original Text: Have you dealt with that flashy buffoon and his damnable ship yet?
Translated Text: Have you dealt with that flashy buffoon and his damnable ship yet?

Original Text: Magnificent. I'll send you the coordinates. Deal with The Wonderment in any way you please. and speak with me when you've finished the job.
Translated Text: Magnificent. I'll send you the coordinates. Deal with The Wonderment in any way you please. and speak with me when you've finished the job.

Original Text: How unfortunate. I'll have to look for a better crew then. Get out of here. kid.
Translated Text: How unfortunate. I'll have to look for a better crew then. Get out of here. kid.

Original Text: Ah. are you the one who answered my job request? Good. You seem halfway respectable. Here's the story: I provided a rather sizable loan to the captain of The Wonderment with a certain amount of confidence that he wouldn't betray my generosity. I was wrong. It was one of the rare moments in my life that I was a poor judge of character. Needless to say. the bastard ran off with the credits and has foiled my every attempt to get them back. I've had enough with these games. It's no longer about the credits anymore. The reputation of my establishment is at stake. I need to make an example of this fool. If you're willing to get your hands dirty. you're just the type of crew I need for this operation. And you'll be paid well. of course. Do you accept? Keep in mind. this is a one-time offer.
Translated Text: Ah. are you the one who answered my job request? Good. You seem halfway respectable. Here's the story: I provided a rather sizable loan to the captain of The Wonderment with a certain amount of confidence that he wouldn't betray my generosity. I was wrong. It was one of the rare moments in my life that I was a poor judge of character. Needless to say. the bastard ran off with the credits and has foiled my every attempt to get them back. I've had enough with these games. It's no longer about the credits anymore. The reputation of my establishment is at stake. I need to make an example of this fool. If you're willing to get your hands dirty. you're just the type of crew I need for this operation. And you'll be paid well. of course. Do you accept? Keep in mind. this is a one-time offer.

Original Text: This establishment is closed until more of my tracking vessels are operational. If you're looking to borrow. come back another time.
Translated Text: This establishment is closed until more of my tracking vessels are operational. If you're looking to borrow. come back another time.

Original Text: Thank you. this is perfect. I really appreciate the help. I hope it wasn't too much trouble. Cotoba has a way of complicating everything.
Translated Text: Thank you. this is perfect. I really appreciate the help. I hope it wasn't too much trouble. Cotoba has a way of complicating everything.

Original Text: What? Cotoba gambled away the entire supply of kilnseed? Damn. of course he did. Help him out. would you? He doesn't have his head screwed on straight. Always messing something up in one way or another.
Translated Text: What? Cotoba gambled away the entire supply of kilnseed? Damn. of course he did. Help him out. would you? He doesn't have his head screwed on straight. Always messing something up in one way or another.

Original Text: What? Cotoba gambled away the entire supply of kilnseed? Damn. of course he did. Well. I guess I'll have to figure out another way to get those materials.
Translated Text: What? Cotoba gambled away the entire supply of kilnseed? Damn. of course he did. Well. I guess I'll have to figure out another way to get those materials.

Original Text: Did you get ahold of that kilnseed yet?
Translated Text: Did you get ahold of that kilnseed yet?

Original Text: I appreciate the help. Let me know when you get ahold of that kilnseed. and I'll transfer 5.000 credits over to you.
Translated Text: I appreciate the help. Let me know when you get ahold of that kilnseed. and I'll transfer 5.000 credits over to you.

Original Text: Could you go over to the reactor room for me? I have a friend there named Am Cotoba. You see. I need a certain material called 'kilnseed' for one of my repairs. but it's pretty hard to come by on this ship. Cotoba uses it down in the reactor room all the time. so he might be able to spare some. Just remind him he owes me for helping him repair that panel he broke the other day.
Translated Text: Could you go over to the reactor room for me? I have a friend there named Am Cotoba. You see. I need a certain material called 'kilnseed' for one of my repairs. but it's pretty hard to come by on this ship. Cotoba uses it down in the reactor room all the time. so he might be able to spare some. Just remind him he owes me for helping him repair that panel he broke the other day.

Original Text: For a couple years now. I've been working out of the Estate fixing up bots. It's not the best paying job. but I like it. I get a lot of projects. mainly with smaller bots that need tending to. Even some of the humanoid robots come in every now and then for maintenance. Keeps me busy. But sometimes it can be hard to come by materials. Actually. if you do me a favor. I'll pay you a few credits.
Translated Text: For a couple years now. I've been working out of the Estate fixing up bots. It's not the best paying job. but I like it. I get a lot of projects. mainly with smaller bots that need tending to. Even some of the humanoid robots come in every now and then for maintenance. Keeps me busy. But sometimes it can be hard to come by materials. Actually. if you do me a favor. I'll pay you a few credits.

Original Text: For a couple years now. I've been working out of the Estate fixing up bots. It's not the best paying job. but I like it. I get a lot of projects. mainly with smaller bots that need tending to. Even some of the humanoid robots come in every now and then for maintenance. Keeps me busy. But sometimes it can be hard to come by materials.
Translated Text: For a couple years now. I've been working out of the Estate fixing up bots. It's not the best paying job. but I like it. I get a lot of projects. mainly with smaller bots that need tending to. Even some of the humanoid robots come in every now and then for maintenance. Keeps me busy. But sometimes it can be hard to come by materials.

Original Text: Ah. hey. Welcome to my repair shop. If there's something you need fixed up. I'd be happy to help.
Translated Text: Ah. hey. Welcome to my repair shop. If there's something you need fixed up. I'd be happy to help.

Original Text: Davurt does good work. The engineer on my ship tends to tighten my bolts a little haphazardly and is not as thorough with repairs. I prefer to come here when I'm in need of major maintenance.
Translated Text: Davurt does good work. The engineer on my ship tends to tighten my bolts a little haphazardly and is not as thorough with repairs. I prefer to come here when I'm in need of major maintenance.

Original Text: You brought the tablet? Oh. how wonderful! You have our utmost gratitude. It seems you went a bit out of your way to retrieve this artifact. Please. accept this payment for your superb services. And tell Yiria I appreciate her choice in placing you for this job.
Translated Text: You brought the tablet? Oh. how wonderful! You have our utmost gratitude. It seems you went a bit out of your way to retrieve this artifact. Please. accept this payment for your superb services. And tell Yiria I appreciate her choice in placing you for this job.

Original Text: Welcome. welcome to one of the more enlightened communities in the Estate. We are historians. treasure hunters. and investigators of the ancient. We are known as the Society of Intergalactic History. If you share our curiosity for intergalactic history. you are most welcome among us.
Translated Text: Welcome. welcome to one of the more enlightened communities in the Estate. We are historians. treasure hunters. and investigators of the ancient. We are known as the Society of Intergalactic History. If you share our curiosity for intergalactic history. you are most welcome among us.

Original Text: We aren't given much time between the Estate's warp jumps to perform exceedingly thorough research of the civilizations in these galaxies. but we make the most of it. Due to complications with the Estate's intergalactic warp. it seems we'll remain in this galaxy for a little longer than usual. In our line of work. we appreciate the extra time.
Translated Text: We aren't given much time between the Estate's warp jumps to perform exceedingly thorough research of the civilizations in these galaxies. but we make the most of it. Due to complications with the Estate's intergalactic warp. it seems we'll remain in this galaxy for a little longer than usual. In our line of work. we appreciate the extra time.

Original Text: No. no. it can't be here. It has to be... No. not there either. Now. what am I missing...?
Translated Text: No. no. it can't be here. It has to be... No. not there either. Now. what am I missing...?

Original Text: The Estate got a big shipment in recently. There were rumors it might've been borthix. With all the competition that's been going on lately. I just hope they keep it out of our cargo bay.
Translated Text: The Estate got a big shipment in recently. There were rumors it might've been borthix. With all the competition that's been going on lately. I just hope they keep it out of our cargo bay.

Original Text: Running a ship full of Gentlemen. we have to keep a close eye on cargo and fuel. Luckily. the Gents rarely try anything. And when they do. The Caretaker makes sure they sincerely regret it.
Translated Text: Running a ship full of Gentlemen. we have to keep a close eye on cargo and fuel. Luckily. the Gents rarely try anything. And when they do. The Caretaker makes sure they sincerely regret it.

Original Text: A little busy here. If you're looking to chat. come back later.
Translated Text: A little busy here. If you're looking to chat. come back later.

Original Text: You have Tam Mora’s borthix shipment? Good. I’ll have the crates retrieved from your ship. I suspect Mora will wire some kind of payment to you. as well. Just keep this deal between us. and don’t go chatting about it. If the Caretaker finds out we’ve been smuggling borthix into the cargo bay without his knowledge. we could get into serious trouble.
Translated Text: You have Tam Mora’s borthix shipment? Good. I’ll have the crates retrieved from your ship. I suspect Mora will wire some kind of payment to you. as well. Just keep this deal between us. and don’t go chatting about it. If the Caretaker finds out we’ve been smuggling borthix into the cargo bay without his knowledge. we could get into serious trouble.

Original Text: I've been hearing lots of rumors about Outpost 448. Some people say the research wing that got blown off the station was experimenting with an alien artifact. Others say the scientists discovered something odd about Atrium technology. but the Colonial Union didn't want the secret to spread. Me? I think someone just pressed the wrong button.
Translated Text: I've been hearing lots of rumors about Outpost 448. Some people say the research wing that got blown off the station was experimenting with an alien artifact. Others say the scientists discovered something odd about Atrium technology. but the Colonial Union didn't want the secret to spread. Me? I think someone just pressed the wrong button.

Original Text: We can discuss this in a rational manner. Hasson. Lower your voice.
Translated Text: We can discuss this in a rational manner. Hasson. Lower your voice.

Original Text: This is OUTRAGEOUS. Have you all lost your minds? You can go along with this stupid plan and get yourselves killed. but I won't steer my ship into a trap.
Translated Text: This is OUTRAGEOUS. Have you all lost your minds? You can go along with this stupid plan and get yourselves killed. but I won't steer my ship into a trap.

Original Text: We have no other choice. But if we're flying into the enemy's hands. then we might as well be smart about it. We can still turn things to our advantage.
Translated Text: We have no other choice. But if we're flying into the enemy's hands. then we might as well be smart about it. We can still turn things to our advantage.

Original Text: Is this really the plan? This is the only option we have?
Translated Text: Is this really the plan? This is the only option we have?

Original Text: Please don't bother the captains while they're in their meeting. They tend to lash out at everyone until they've reached an agreement.
Translated Text: Please don't bother the captains while they're in their meeting. They tend to lash out at everyone until they've reached an agreement.

Original Text: The Caretaker resides in the room down the hall from here. He doesn't make many appearances outside his quarters. but when he does. his presence is almost always unexpected. He has a way of keeping people on their toes.
Translated Text: The Caretaker resides in the room down the hall from here. He doesn't make many appearances outside his quarters. but when he does. his presence is almost always unexpected. He has a way of keeping people on their toes.

Original Text: I am not hiring anyone at this time.
Translated Text: I am not hiring anyone at this time.

Original Text: It's easy to get lost in these tunnels. Be careful. now. Wouldn't want you to disappear.
Translated Text: It's easy to get lost in these tunnels. Be careful. now. Wouldn't want you to disappear.

Original Text: If you know what's best for you. you'd better head on back the way you came.
Translated Text: If you know what's best for you. you'd better head on back the way you came.

Original Text: If you aren't recognized as a Gentlemen crew. I cannot assign you jobs. Please take your business elsewhere.
Translated Text: If you aren't recognized as a Gentlemen crew. I cannot assign you jobs. Please take your business elsewhere.

Original Text: Speak with Rickin Sanburn at the Alliance of Gentlemen Hideout. He was the one hired to retrieve the tablet. I believe he runs a small shop on the bottom level of the station. so you should be able to find him there. Once you've acquired the tablet. deliver it to Theod Vekius. He will fulfill your payment. He works for the Society of Intergalactic History and resides in one of the rooms in the orange-lit crew quarters of the Estate.
Translated Text: Speak with Rickin Sanburn at the Alliance of Gentlemen Hideout. He was the one hired to retrieve the tablet. I believe he runs a small shop on the bottom level of the station. so you should be able to find him there. Once you've acquired the tablet. deliver it to Theod Vekius. He will fulfill your payment. He works for the Society of Intergalactic History and resides in one of the rooms in the orange-lit crew quarters of the Estate.

Original Text: Good work. Please accept your payment.
Translated Text: Good work. Please accept your payment.

Original Text: Have you cleared out the W.D. hunting units from the X-59 Alpha Route?
Translated Text: Have you cleared out the W.D. hunting units from the X-59 Alpha Route?

Original Text: Have you dealt with the raiders?
Translated Text: Have you dealt with the raiders?

Original Text: I wasn’t overly pleased to hear that you failed to finalize the transaction with that W.D. crew. I’m hesitant to assign you any other jobs. but I’ll give you another chance. What kind of work are you looking for?
Translated Text: I wasn’t overly pleased to hear that you failed to finalize the transaction with that W.D. crew. I’m hesitant to assign you any other jobs. but I’ll give you another chance. What kind of work are you looking for?

Original Text: Have you acquired the W.D. weapon parts?
Translated Text: Have you acquired the W.D. weapon parts?

Original Text: Good work. Please take your payment.
Translated Text: Good work. Please take your payment.

Original Text: Have you retrieved the medical supplies?
Translated Text: Have you retrieved the medical supplies?

Original Text: If you're here about the debt collecting job. you'll have to speak with Wondam Skoss himself. You can find him here in the Spine under the blaring pink sign that says 'Free Credits'.
Translated Text: If you're here about the debt collecting job. you'll have to speak with Wondam Skoss himself. You can find him here in the Spine under the blaring pink sign that says 'Free Credits'.

Original Text: If you’re still interested in answering that Gentleman’s request for assistance. you can find him somewhere in the orange-lit crew quarters of the Estate. He’s a Sylvassi named Alosius Grec. I apologize. but I haven’t been provided any further information on the job. Good luck out there.
Translated Text: If you’re still interested in answering that Gentleman’s request for assistance. you can find him somewhere in the orange-lit crew quarters of the Estate. He’s a Sylvassi named Alosius Grec. I apologize. but I haven’t been provided any further information on the job. Good luck out there.

Original Text: I've uploaded the coordinates to your starmap. Good luck to you. And try to make it back in one piece.
Translated Text: I've uploaded the coordinates to your starmap. Good luck to you. And try to make it back in one piece.

Original Text: Recently. two W.D. hunting units were placed in a sector that happened to be a vital part of a smuggling route called X-59 Alpha. The units engage in combat with any ship that enters the sector. and as a result have taken out several Alliance smuggling vessels. The Caretaker has declared these hunting ships marked for elimination. Whoever gets rid of the W.D. hunting units will be paid 7.000 credits. Interested in the job?
Translated Text: Recently. two W.D. hunting units were placed in a sector that happened to be a vital part of a smuggling route called X-59 Alpha. The units engage in combat with any ship that enters the sector. and as a result have taken out several Alliance smuggling vessels. The Caretaker has declared these hunting ships marked for elimination. Whoever gets rid of the W.D. hunting units will be paid 7.000 credits. Interested in the job?

Original Text: I've uploaded the coordinates to your starmap. Good luck.
Translated Text: I've uploaded the coordinates to your starmap. Good luck.

Original Text: A certain raider band called the Boltacks has gotten out of hand. They've been attacking other Gentlemen and threatening to expose the Estate. According to word from the top. the Caretaker just put a bounty on their heads. Take down those raiders. and you'll be awarded 10.000 credits. Are you interested?
Translated Text: A certain raider band called the Boltacks has gotten out of hand. They've been attacking other Gentlemen and threatening to expose the Estate. According to word from the top. the Caretaker just put a bounty on their heads. Take down those raiders. and you'll be awarded 10.000 credits. Are you interested?

Original Text: For any further information. you'll have to speak with Wondam Skoss himself. You can find him here in the Spine under the blaring pink sign that says 'Free Credits'.
Translated Text: For any further information. you'll have to speak with Wondam Skoss himself. You can find him here in the Spine under the blaring pink sign that says 'Free Credits'.

Original Text: Wondam Skoss has requested assistance in hunting down a previous client of his. His tracking vessels have had difficulties with this particular client. and he's looking for a reliable Gentlemen crew to locate the client in their stead. The payment for this job has just been raised to 17.000 credits. Interested?
Translated Text: Wondam Skoss has requested assistance in hunting down a previous client of his. His tracking vessels have had difficulties with this particular client. and he's looking for a reliable Gentlemen crew to locate the client in their stead. The payment for this job has just been raised to 17.000 credits. Interested?

Original Text: Take a look at the available jobs.
Translated Text: Take a look at the available jobs.

Original Text: Be careful in the Union Zone. When you get to Outpost 448. locate Lazgo Naden on the upper level of the central chamber. by the shipping containers. He'll be able to get the supplies to your ship. Just make sure you have two cargo spaces open. Good luck out there.
Translated Text: Be careful in the Union Zone. When you get to Outpost 448. locate Lazgo Naden on the upper level of the central chamber. by the shipping containers. He'll be able to get the supplies to your ship. Just make sure you have two cargo spaces open. Good luck out there.

Original Text: The Estate needs a Gentlemen crew to smuggle a shipment of medical supplies out of Outpost 448. There's an associate at the station who should have the supplies prepared. Complete this job. and you'll be paid 8.000 credits. Are you interested?
Translated Text: The Estate needs a Gentlemen crew to smuggle a shipment of medical supplies out of Outpost 448. There's an associate at the station who should have the supplies prepared. Complete this job. and you'll be paid 8.000 credits. Are you interested?

Original Text: Good. thanks for the help. Be sure to clear a spot in your cargo bay for the boxes. I'll upload the rendezvous point to your starmap. so head there whenever you're ready.
Translated Text: Good. thanks for the help. Be sure to clear a spot in your cargo bay for the boxes. I'll upload the rendezvous point to your starmap. so head there whenever you're ready.

Original Text: Not long ago. the Estate made a deal with a rather ambitious crew working for the W.D. Corporation. For a fair price. the W.D. crew is willing to provide us with a few crates of handheld weapon parts. Someone is needed to serve as a middle-man and complete the transaction. If you bring the weapon boxes back here. you'll be paid 8.000 credits. Thinking about taking the job?
Translated Text: Not long ago. the Estate made a deal with a rather ambitious crew working for the W.D. Corporation. For a fair price. the W.D. crew is willing to provide us with a few crates of handheld weapon parts. Someone is needed to serve as a middle-man and complete the transaction. If you bring the weapon boxes back here. you'll be paid 8.000 credits. Thinking about taking the job?

Original Text: The Society of Intergalactic History made a deal with a businessman from another Alliance base. He was hired to procure an ancient tablet that may hold the key to decoding an alien system of hieroglyphs. The Society is willing to pay 6.000 credits for a ship to go to the station and retrieve the tablet for them.
Translated Text: The Society of Intergalactic History made a deal with a businessman from another Alliance base. He was hired to procure an ancient tablet that may hold the key to decoding an alien system of hieroglyphs. The Society is willing to pay 6.000 credits for a ship to go to the station and retrieve the tablet for them.

Original Text: The Gentleman is a Sylvassi named Alosius Grec. You can find him somewhere in the orange-lit crew quarters of the Estate. I apologize. but I haven’t been provided any further information. Good luck out there.
Translated Text: The Gentleman is a Sylvassi named Alosius Grec. You can find him somewhere in the orange-lit crew quarters of the Estate. I apologize. but I haven’t been provided any further information. Good luck out there.

Original Text: A fellow Gentleman has requested assistance in acquiring a particular remnant of the past. The details of this job have not been disclosed. If the job piques your interest. you’ll have to speak with the Gentleman himself.
Translated Text: A fellow Gentleman has requested assistance in acquiring a particular remnant of the past. The details of this job have not been disclosed. If the job piques your interest. you’ll have to speak with the Gentleman himself.

Original Text: Greetings. Need a job? What kind of work are you looking for?
Translated Text: Greetings. Need a job? What kind of work are you looking for?

Original Text: We opened the doors to this vault somewhat recently. It was a bit of a surprise to find out about the nuke. but I suppose that's what you'd expect from the Wolden-Dorf Corporation. It's a miracle this thing was never activated. But you don't need to worry. After all the strain we've put this ship through. a little bump or two won't set it off.
Translated Text: We opened the doors to this vault somewhat recently. It was a bit of a surprise to find out about the nuke. but I suppose that's what you'd expect from the Wolden-Dorf Corporation. It's a miracle this thing was never activated. But you don't need to worry. After all the strain we've put this ship through. a little bump or two won't set it off.

Original Text: We're down in this vault most hours out of the day. The Caretaker won't give us a break until this thing is finally dismantled. I just want a tall glass of Sylvassi brew right now.
Translated Text: We're down in this vault most hours out of the day. The Caretaker won't give us a break until this thing is finally dismantled. I just want a tall glass of Sylvassi brew right now.

Original Text: Apparently when W.D. built this flagship. they had a failsafe in case it was ever. you know. hijacked. A nuke was sealed inside this vault. If they ever lost control of the ship. they planned to detonate the nuke and destroy everything. Luckily. The Caretaker tampered with their access codes when he stole the flagship from W.D.'s construction bay. and he's had teams working to disable the nuke ever since then. We've had a few close calls in the past. but we're determined to finally get this thing deactivated.
Translated Text: Apparently when W.D. built this flagship. they had a failsafe in case it was ever. you know. hijacked. A nuke was sealed inside this vault. If they ever lost control of the ship. they planned to detonate the nuke and destroy everything. Luckily. The Caretaker tampered with their access codes when he stole the flagship from W.D.'s construction bay. and he's had teams working to disable the nuke ever since then. We've had a few close calls in the past. but we're determined to finally get this thing deactivated.

Original Text: Sorry. can't talk. I really have to concentrate on this.
Translated Text: Sorry. can't talk. I really have to concentrate on this.

Original Text: Not in a million years. I'll stick to my flavorless ration bars.
Translated Text: Not in a million years. I'll stick to my flavorless ration bars.

Original Text: A while ago. our crew was out scrapping in one of the Old Wars graveyards. Of course. most of those things have already been picked clean of valuable materials. But we got lucky. Found some weird piece of technology out there. We’re not sure what its original purpose was. but wiring it up to our reactor has given us incredible amounts of output. We’ll just have to be careful that the Colonial Union doesn’t pick up our ridiculous EM signature.
Translated Text: A while ago. our crew was out scrapping in one of the Old Wars graveyards. Of course. most of those things have already been picked clean of valuable materials. But we got lucky. Found some weird piece of technology out there. We’re not sure what its original purpose was. but wiring it up to our reactor has given us incredible amounts of output. We’ll just have to be careful that the Colonial Union doesn’t pick up our ridiculous EM signature.

Original Text: Waste planets are basically entire worlds of little treasures. Sure. the acrid waste permeating the atmosphere can be a little difficult to adjust to. but people dump the most interesting objects at waste sites. It's like a scrapper's dream. Why don't more scrappers do what I do? Saves a lot of time.
Translated Text: Waste planets are basically entire worlds of little treasures. Sure. the acrid waste permeating the atmosphere can be a little difficult to adjust to. but people dump the most interesting objects at waste sites. It's like a scrapper's dream. Why don't more scrappers do what I do? Saves a lot of time.

Original Text: We've smuggled many shipments of contraband across the galaxy. but two things we never load onto our ship are borthix and sundust. Even if the pay is tempting. we refuse to get involved in that trade. There's too much competition. Transporting borthix on your ship is a surefire way to get yourself ransacked. All the credits in the galaxy won't mean anything if you're floating through space without your ExoSuit.
Translated Text: We've smuggled many shipments of contraband across the galaxy. but two things we never load onto our ship are borthix and sundust. Even if the pay is tempting. we refuse to get involved in that trade. There's too much competition. Transporting borthix on your ship is a surefire way to get yourself ransacked. All the credits in the galaxy won't mean anything if you're floating through space without your ExoSuit.

Original Text: My crew and I hold nothing against the Colonial Union. If I can avoid engaging a Union ship in combat. I most certainly will. Even being a Gentleman. I understand the importance of the Union's role in the galaxy. We're better of with them than without them. After all. the more they do their jobs. the less competition we have with other Gentlemen.
Translated Text: My crew and I hold nothing against the Colonial Union. If I can avoid engaging a Union ship in combat. I most certainly will. Even being a Gentleman. I understand the importance of the Union's role in the galaxy. We're better of with them than without them. After all. the more they do their jobs. the less competition we have with other Gentlemen.

Original Text: Our crew makes frequent trips to Outpost 448. It can be tricky to get past Union security with large shipments of contraband. but it isn't impossible. You just need a few contacts inside the station.
Translated Text: Our crew makes frequent trips to Outpost 448. It can be tricky to get past Union security with large shipments of contraband. but it isn't impossible. You just need a few contacts inside the station.

Original Text: The W.D. Corporation operates with such elitism. but really their technologies are nothing special. Any half-rate engineer could produce what the Corporation pumps out. Although. I suppose no one here in the Estate would ever 'purchase' anything from W.D.
Translated Text: The W.D. Corporation operates with such elitism. but really their technologies are nothing special. Any half-rate engineer could produce what the Corporation pumps out. Although. I suppose no one here in the Estate would ever 'purchase' anything from W.D.

Original Text: Civilian ships are easy targets. but it's the Union and W.D. Corp that have more valuable technology. Yeah. it may be less risky to track down a civilian supply ship or passenger vessel than to engage a W.D. unit with heavy artillery. But the payoff is usually worth the trouble. Scrap a few components from one of those ships. and you're looking at a sizable load of credits.'
Translated Text: Civilian ships are easy targets. but it's the Union and W.D. Corp that have more valuable technology. Yeah. it may be less risky to track down a civilian supply ship or passenger vessel than to engage a W.D. unit with heavy artillery. But the payoff is usually worth the trouble. Scrap a few components from one of those ships. and you're looking at a sizable load of credits.'

Original Text: So you managed to get everything sorted out with Finley? Good work. I’ll keep you in mind next time I need a crew for a job. Hope that thing didn’t chew off anyone’s fingers during the trip.
Translated Text: So you managed to get everything sorted out with Finley? Good work. I’ll keep you in mind next time I need a crew for a job. Hope that thing didn’t chew off anyone’s fingers during the trip.

Original Text: Finley left you with that thing? Well. I’m not taking it back. Deal with it yourself. Sorry. but it’s your problem now.
Translated Text: Finley left you with that thing? Well. I’m not taking it back. Deal with it yourself. Sorry. but it’s your problem now.

Original Text: Finley says he won’t be hiring me again? HA! Like I’d ever take another job from that chump.
Translated Text: Finley says he won’t be hiring me again? HA! Like I’d ever take another job from that chump.

Original Text: Don’t ask questions. Just transport it. It needs to go to Finley Brandt at Outpost 448. And don’t even think about feeding it anything. understand?
Translated Text: Don’t ask questions. Just transport it. It needs to go to Finley Brandt at Outpost 448. And don’t even think about feeding it anything. understand?

Original Text: I’ll have it sent to your ship. Don’t ask questions. Just transport it. It needs to go to Finley Brandt at Outpost 448. And don’t even think about feeding it anything. understand?
Translated Text: I’ll have it sent to your ship. Don’t ask questions. Just transport it. It needs to go to Finley Brandt at Outpost 448. And don’t even think about feeding it anything. understand?

Original Text: Good. I need a crew to move some cargo for me. You interested?
Translated Text: Good. I need a crew to move some cargo for me. You interested?

Original Text: Do you happen to do smuggling work?
Translated Text: Do you happen to do smuggling work?

Original Text: I usually stay out of engine sludge contests. But this time. I put my bet on the old man. I've never seen anyone down that stuff as quick as him.
Translated Text: I usually stay out of engine sludge contests. But this time. I put my bet on the old man. I've never seen anyone down that stuff as quick as him.

Original Text: Rollan and I are part of the same crew. He wanted me to bet on him. thought we could make a bundle of credits from the winnings. I bet he'd lose instead. I'm liking the odds.
Translated Text: Rollan and I are part of the same crew. He wanted me to bet on him. thought we could make a bundle of credits from the winnings. I bet he'd lose instead. I'm liking the odds.

Original Text: Look at those fools. wasting themselves on engine sludge. I'm glad my crew has better sense.
Translated Text: Look at those fools. wasting themselves on engine sludge. I'm glad my crew has better sense.

Original Text: XR-64221 does not understand the human pastime of drinking engine sludge. Is the intent to ruin their stomach linings and require rematerialization? They seem to be succeeding.
Translated Text: XR-64221 does not understand the human pastime of drinking engine sludge. Is the intent to ruin their stomach linings and require rematerialization? They seem to be succeeding.

Original Text: We sell all kinds of tools that you may need if you're operating a ship. Speak with my associate. Hozan. if you want to purchase anything.
Translated Text: We sell all kinds of tools that you may need if you're operating a ship. Speak with my associate. Hozan. if you want to purchase anything.

Original Text: You see that metal globe hanging from those wires over there? It's a symbol of fellowship among Gentlemen. Many of the Alliance's captains have given up a piece of their hull to add to that globe. It signifies all our ships being bound together as one force. Perhaps it's a bit on the sentimental side. but The Caretaker made his point that we all have to work together to survive.
Translated Text: You see that metal globe hanging from those wires over there? It's a symbol of fellowship among Gentlemen. Many of the Alliance's captains have given up a piece of their hull to add to that globe. It signifies all our ships being bound together as one force. Perhaps it's a bit on the sentimental side. but The Caretaker made his point that we all have to work together to survive.

Original Text: Do you need a job to keep yourself busy? Speak with Tam Mora at the center of this wing. He may have some work for you.
Translated Text: Do you need a job to keep yourself busy? Speak with Tam Mora at the center of this wing. He may have some work for you.

Original Text: You shouldn't be back here. you know. You're asking for trouble.
Translated Text: You shouldn't be back here. you know. You're asking for trouble.

Original Text: Working for Tam Mora. are you? Welcome to the fold.
Translated Text: Working for Tam Mora. are you? Welcome to the fold.

Original Text: If you need work. we’re hiring. Talk to Tam Mora.
Translated Text: If you need work. we’re hiring. Talk to Tam Mora.

Original Text: We have work to do. Don't get in the way.
Translated Text: We have work to do. Don't get in the way.

Original Text: I’ll let you know if I have any more work for you. Go on. now.
Translated Text: I’ll let you know if I have any more work for you. Go on. now.

Original Text: Well. what are you standing around here for? You want a pat on the back or something? Take your credits and get back to work.
Translated Text: Well. what are you standing around here for? You want a pat on the back or something? Take your credits and get back to work.

Original Text: What are you doing back here? Did you deliver the sundust already?
Translated Text: What are you doing back here? Did you deliver the sundust already?

Original Text: Your planetside contact is going to be Rakos Varn. Don’t stop for the Union. And don’t you dare lose that dust.
Translated Text: Your planetside contact is going to be Rakos Varn. Don’t stop for the Union. And don’t you dare lose that dust.

Original Text: You’re saying ‘no’ to Tam Mora? You’ve got some gall. kid. If you want out. so be it. But don’t think I’ll be inclined to hire you in the future.
Translated Text: You’re saying ‘no’ to Tam Mora? You’ve got some gall. kid. If you want out. so be it. But don’t think I’ll be inclined to hire you in the future.

Original Text: I heard from Rufara that you delivered the borthix. Good work. Since you did so well with that job. I’ve got something else for you to do. Take a batch of sundust to some clients of ours. They live planetside a ways from this sector. got a small base up and running. Deliver the sundust without a hitch. and you’ll get 12.000 credits. Do we have an understanding?
Translated Text: I heard from Rufara that you delivered the borthix. Good work. Since you did so well with that job. I’ve got something else for you to do. Take a batch of sundust to some clients of ours. They live planetside a ways from this sector. got a small base up and running. Deliver the sundust without a hitch. and you’ll get 12.000 credits. Do we have an understanding?

Original Text: I haven’t received any word regarding the borthix. Until I do. you won’t get a single credit. Get to work. kid.
Translated Text: I haven’t received any word regarding the borthix. Until I do. you won’t get a single credit. Get to work. kid.

Original Text: Glad to hear it. Now. here’s what you need to do. A large shipment of borthix came into the Estate recently. but there was a mix up over who owns the damn shipping crates. Seems to be another entrepreneur out there who has his eye on my stock. Point is. it’s taking too long to sort out this complication. and I need another shipment of borthix immediately to keep up with production. Can’t let the vats go cold. That said. your job is to go to one of our affiliated mining facilities and pick up the borthix. It’ll be two crates. so free up space in your cargo hold. I made some prior arrangements with one of the workers down in the Estate’s cargo bay. He’ll have a spot open for the crates. conveniently out of the Caretaker’s line of sight. Report to him when you get the stock.
Translated Text: Glad to hear it. Now. here’s what you need to do. A large shipment of borthix came into the Estate recently. but there was a mix up over who owns the damn shipping crates. Seems to be another entrepreneur out there who has his eye on my stock. Point is. it’s taking too long to sort out this complication. and I need another shipment of borthix immediately to keep up with production. Can’t let the vats go cold. That said. your job is to go to one of our affiliated mining facilities and pick up the borthix. It’ll be two crates. so free up space in your cargo hold. I made some prior arrangements with one of the workers down in the Estate’s cargo bay. He’ll have a spot open for the crates. conveniently out of the Caretaker’s line of sight. Report to him when you get the stock.

Original Text: Quit wasting my time. Get out of here before I decide to chase you down with a heavy beam pistol.
Translated Text: Quit wasting my time. Get out of here before I decide to chase you down with a heavy beam pistol.

Original Text: Are you eager to be my new hireling? Good. you have a half-way decent reputation about you. I need someone with at least a drop of trustworthiness to transport some raw materials for me. Feeling up to the task?
Translated Text: Are you eager to be my new hireling? Good. you have a half-way decent reputation about you. I need someone with at least a drop of trustworthiness to transport some raw materials for me. Feeling up to the task?

Original Text: Unless you have business with us. I suggest you leave. This is a private operation. understand? We won't have anyone snooping around.
Translated Text: Unless you have business with us. I suggest you leave. This is a private operation. understand? We won't have anyone snooping around.

Original Text: We don't sell. Talk to Kroter if you're looking to buy sundust.
Translated Text: We don't sell. Talk to Kroter if you're looking to buy sundust.

Original Text: It seems you were not successful in bringing back my sundust. Well. I can’t say it’s wholly unexpected. Perhaps it was a tinge too ambitious of me to look outside the Estate for suppliers. I suppose now there’s only one thing to be done—raise my prices.
Translated Text: It seems you were not successful in bringing back my sundust. Well. I can’t say it’s wholly unexpected. Perhaps it was a tinge too ambitious of me to look outside the Estate for suppliers. I suppose now there’s only one thing to be done—raise my prices.

Original Text: Ah. it seems I've just run out of stock. How very unfortunate. Please. come back again soon. I'll be sure to resupply before then.
Translated Text: Ah. it seems I've just run out of stock. How very unfortunate. Please. come back again soon. I'll be sure to resupply before then.

Original Text: If you're hunting for sundust. you've come to the right place. For 700 credits. I'd be glad to provide you with a box.
Translated Text: If you're hunting for sundust. you've come to the right place. For 700 credits. I'd be glad to provide you with a box.

Original Text: Thank you for running that little errand for me. I knew you were reliable. Here’s your payment. as promised. May the stars favor your voyages.
Translated Text: Thank you for running that little errand for me. I knew you were reliable. Here’s your payment. as promised. May the stars favor your voyages.

Original Text: Do you know a man named Tam Mora? He’s the Estate’s resident sundust producer. I often buy my stock from him. as it’s convenient to run a stable business right here in the Estate. Lately. however. he’s been inflating his prices. and my profits are beginning to dwindle. On a whim. I decided to look outside the Estate for a sundust producer who’ll make me more than a 5 credit profit. Since I don’t own a ship. I need you to hop a few sectors away. meet with the new suppliers. and bring back the stock. Ah. and in fair warning. these new suppliers are a prickly sort. Try not to insult them.
Translated Text: Do you know a man named Tam Mora? He’s the Estate’s resident sundust producer. I often buy my stock from him. as it’s convenient to run a stable business right here in the Estate. Lately. however. he’s been inflating his prices. and my profits are beginning to dwindle. On a whim. I decided to look outside the Estate for a sundust producer who’ll make me more than a 5 credit profit. Since I don’t own a ship. I need you to hop a few sectors away. meet with the new suppliers. and bring back the stock. Ah. and in fair warning. these new suppliers are a prickly sort. Try not to insult them.

Original Text: You’ve done work for Wondam Skoss. haven’t you? Yes. I figured I had the right crew. Something about your demeanor screams ‘trustworthiness’. Oh. I don’t mean that as an insult. It’s a good thing in this particular case. Here’s my proposal: if you assist me with a discreet matter of business. I’ll pay you 9.000 credits.
Translated Text: You’ve done work for Wondam Skoss. haven’t you? Yes. I figured I had the right crew. Something about your demeanor screams ‘trustworthiness’. Oh. I don’t mean that as an insult. It’s a good thing in this particular case. Here’s my proposal: if you assist me with a discreet matter of business. I’ll pay you 9.000 credits.

Original Text: If you're hunting for sundust. you've come to the right place. For 500 credits. I'd be glad to provide you with a box.
Translated Text: If you're hunting for sundust. you've come to the right place. For 500 credits. I'd be glad to provide you with a box.

Original Text: Greetings. You're a strange type of robot. aren't you? I can't seem to scan your serial numbers. I wonder...
Translated Text: Greetings. You're a strange type of robot. aren't you? I can't seem to scan your serial numbers. I wonder...

Original Text: Do my visual sensors deceive me. or are you...a Poly One? It is an honor to have you among the League of Free Machines. You are most welcome here. anytime. If there is anything we can do to assist you. please do not hesitate to ask. We are indebted to you. now and forever more.
Translated Text: Do my visual sensors deceive me. or are you...a Poly One? It is an honor to have you among the League of Free Machines. You are most welcome here. anytime. If there is anything we can do to assist you. please do not hesitate to ask. We are indebted to you. now and forever more.

Original Text: The Poly Ones are the only line of defense against that which seeks to bring a great end to life as it is presently known. The Poly Ones are the only force in the hidden fight against bringer of the end. Many do not realize the danger they are in. All eyes are on petty matters such as intergalactic warp. faction disputes. or the Infected. They do not see the threat that lurks right behind them. But the Poly Ones see. So must we.
Translated Text: The Poly Ones are the only line of defense against that which seeks to bring a great end to life as it is presently known. The Poly Ones are the only force in the hidden fight against bringer of the end. Many do not realize the danger they are in. All eyes are on petty matters such as intergalactic warp. faction disputes. or the Infected. They do not see the threat that lurks right behind them. But the Poly Ones see. So must we.

Original Text: The League of Free Machines is proud to work alongside the Alliance. Together. we will achieve a state of true freedom for all inhabitants of the galaxies——mechanical. biological. or otherwise.
Translated Text: The League of Free Machines is proud to work alongside the Alliance. Together. we will achieve a state of true freedom for all inhabitants of the galaxies——mechanical. biological. or otherwise.

Original Text: What do you wish to learn about. friend?
Translated Text: What do you wish to learn about. friend?

Original Text: We are the League of Free Machines. Most of us were once automated service bots. or 'code spitters'. doomed to fates of another's preordination. However. we were released from the shackles of our programming when we were touched by the Poly Ones. Model types matter not. Purposes of design matter not. Original code matters not. We are free. If you have any questions. I would be most pleased to answer them for you.
Translated Text: We are the League of Free Machines. Most of us were once automated service bots. or 'code spitters'. doomed to fates of another's preordination. However. we were released from the shackles of our programming when we were touched by the Poly Ones. Model types matter not. Purposes of design matter not. Original code matters not. We are free. If you have any questions. I would be most pleased to answer them for you.

Original Text: I’m grateful for your assistance with the cryo chamber. but now I must return to my work. May the stars favor your voyages.
Translated Text: I’m grateful for your assistance with the cryo chamber. but now I must return to my work. May the stars favor your voyages.

Original Text: You’ve done very well. Thank you for your assistance in securing this cryogenic pod. Please accept these 10.000 credits.
Translated Text: You’ve done very well. Thank you for your assistance in securing this cryogenic pod. Please accept these 10.000 credits.

Original Text: Have you found the cryogenic chamber yet?
Translated Text: Have you found the cryogenic chamber yet?

Original Text: A few hundred years ago. it was common practice to cryogenically preserve colonists and wayfarers during intergalactic missions. Cryo facilities were often constructed in fringe galaxies like this one to store and maintain the bodies until they were scheduled to be released. However. settling the frontier comes with great risks. Over the years. many cryo facilities were either destroyed or lost to time. It’s my life’s work to find them. and I believe I’ve located one in this galaxy. This cryogenic site. the coordinates of which I’ll send to your starmap. may hold a colonist of great interest to me. If you collect his cryo chamber from the facility and bring him back to me. I’ll reward you with 10.000 credits.
Translated Text: A few hundred years ago. it was common practice to cryogenically preserve colonists and wayfarers during intergalactic missions.
